column2: Tindak Malaysia (2023), Straits Times 21st February 1955, Federation of Malaya Government Gazette 1954. Refer to MALAYA_1955_DUN_CANDIDATE_AGE_SOURCE for candidate age sources

There may be discrepancies for the age of candidates as there is no official data released for the attribute.There may be a presence for missing data points for age attribute for candidates. TindakMalaysia Network Services PLT is not responsible for any errors or ommissions arising from the original data or its derivatives
Composite between Parliamentary Code and DUN Code (Unique Identifier). This is left empty
State Constituencies for the Settlement Council of Penang (created in 1954)
Party/Coalition (with Component Party) who won the seat
Indicator if there was one contestant for the said election. If yes, value Y is affixed. If none, it is left blank
The difference between the highest valid votes and second highest valid votes
Proportion of Total Ballots Issued as a share of Total Electorate
Total number of ballot papers issued at the poll (as in A in all Form 14 + A in Form 15)
Total number of ballot papers issued but not put in the ballot box (as in D in all Form 14) and not returned (as in D in Form 15) (B-C-D) (no information is available)
Total number of rejected ballot papers (as in C in all Form 14 + C in Form 15)
Total number of votes by electors
Alliance Valid Vote for the Candidate
Indicated if the contestant has lost deposit. If yes, value 'Loss Deposit' is affixed. If none, it is left blank
Party Valid Vote for the Other Party Candidate
Indicated if the contestant has lost deposit. If yes, value 'Lost Deposit' is affixed. If none, it is left blank
Party Valid Vote for the Other Party Candidate
Indicated if the contestant has lost deposit. If yes, value 'Lost Deposit' is affixed. If none, it is left blank
Independent Valid Vote for the Candidate
Indicated if the contestant has lost deposit. If yes, value 'Lost Deposit' is affixed. If none, it is left blank
